intro: Sisyrinchium hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, giving it its common name. Sisyrinchium hirsutum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
